fields.storyName: The Working Professional Single Mother Raising Two
fields.summary: Working professional 35-54 year old mother of two that has recently been divorced and is now juggling responsibilities at work with taking care of the kids during the week.
fields.introduction: Due to a downturn in the economy she has been let go from her job as an accounting professional for a national hotel chain
fields.middle: While has been able to set aside a financial emergency fund that   will help her cover daily living expenses for herself and her two children over the next 4 months, she is in need of additional financial support should it take longer than 4 months to line-up another job opportunity
fields.conclusion: This is where her existing job loss insurance policy provides reassurance and peace of mind that she and her children will be able to cope, and enable her to successfully search for new employment opportunities from a stronger position of power.
fields.keyInsights: A job loss insurance provides the necessary financial protection and peace of mind to protect my family in case of the main bread-earner�s loss of income.

fields.summary: +55 year retired husband, + 55 year old still working wife, three children that are now financially standing on their own feet
fields.introduction: The children have successfully gone off to college and started their working professional careers. He has retired already with her looking forward to retiring within the next 2 years.
fields.middle: They are enjoying their new found freedom and flexibility with their children having moved out of the nest and successfully standing on their own feet and together are contemplating relocating to warmer-weather once she has successfully retired as well. While they probably have enough financial reso
fields.conclusion: To adequately be prepared for the eventuality they are looking into a Critical Illness type product that provides coverage in such a scenario.
fields.keyInsights: A Critical Illness policy can provide the financial coverage needed to cover unexpected expensive medical bills that are more likely to accrue with older age.

fields.storyName: The Young Professional Caring For Her Critically I
fields.summary: Young working professional <34 years that moved back in at home to care of her critically ill mother
fields.keyInsights: A disability insurance can be a worthwhile investment for individuals at the beginning of their career who have no immediate dependents they could rely on for help in the potential event of disability.

fields.buttleName: Check for sufficient debt & long-term needs cover
fields.buttleMessaging: Is your existing insurance enough to cover your debt and look after your family�s immediate and long-term needs?

fields.buttleName: Typical employer life insurance often insufficient
fields.buttleMessaging: Typically, life insurance provided through employers only provides coverage that amounts to 1 to 2 times your salary in the event of your death. Would that be enough to cover your debt and look after your family�s immediate and long-term needs?
Disability insurance through your employer might only replace a portion of your current income (e.g., 60-70%). Would you be able to manage with less income and increased expenses?

fields.buttleMessaging: Have you considered if you leave your employer or lose your job, that any group coverage you have through your employer may terminate, meaning you and your family could be left without coverage?

fields.buttleName: Liquidation of assets impact on retirement
fields.buttleMessaging: If you liquidate assets, would that disrupt your savings or retirement planning goals? And what would happen if your family had to suddenly sell your assets in a down market to pay off your debts?
